result.title: RISEus2 project visual identity ready and page in website bbcentre.eu developed
result.description: RISEus2 project visual identity ready and page in website bbcentreeu developed1 Development of RISEus2 project visual identity logo presentationposter template deliverable template informative rollup responsible for the activity RTU RBIDC approval form Project Steering Committee2 Development of dedicated page in the bbcentreeu website included in the main navigation barThe dedicated page on the website will contain all the necessary information related to the implementation of the project description partners mobility topics etcThe page will be active and frequently at least once a month updated Materials photos presentations from the events organised by the RTU RBIDC such as delivered lectures and training will be provided there Time table and the agenda of RISEus2 activities will be published and updated in a timely manner at least once in 3 monthsThe Project information on the bbcentreeu website will be sustained after the end of the project for at least 2 years

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: First training module for Climate Smart Farming demonstration
result.description: Following the publication of the Climate Farm Demo guide (D3.1), a training module will be developed, for subsequent delivery to all partners. Training will be organised during annual meetings and will follow a two-step logic. During the annual international meetings, the NCs/CFAs will be trained on the respective topics. During the national meetings, the NCs/CFAs will train the PDFs (Task 1.5).

result.title: Strategic Plan for the PIPs
result.description: The Strategic Plan for the PIPs will include the inventory of relevant EU projects, flagship initiatives and policy-makers and a detailed description of the activities that will be developed in each of these components, by TEAGASC (projects), IFOAM & CLIMATE-KIC (flagship initiatives) and ELO (policy makers). The Strategic Plan will be co-developed by CONSULAI together with these four organizations and the other core partners of the WP (IDELE and Biosense), and then validated by all partners, namely by the National Coordinators, which will have a major role on developing links with policy makers at national / regional level.
